image.alt: Hess Orthodontics team smiling in office

paragraphs.text: Hess Orthodontics is a family-focused orthodontic practice delivering advanced, personalized care across several convenient Florida locations. Our specialists combine years of experience with modern orthodontic technology to create healthy, beautiful smiles in a comfortable, welcoming environment.
We prioritize excellent outcomes, patient comfort, and flexible options to make treatment easy for every family, with scheduling and locations designed around busy lives.

items.title: Deep Experience

image.alt: Experienced orthodontic care

items.text: More than a decade of specialist care and thousands of treated patients focused on predictable, high-quality outcomes.

items.title: Advanced Options

image.alt: Modern orthodontic technology

items.text: State-of-the-art treatments including Invisalign<sup>®</sup> and Damon self-ligating braces for efficient, comfortable care.

items.title: Convenient Locations

image.alt: Multiple office locations

items.text: Multiple offices across West Coastal and Central Florida, with flexible appointment times to fit family schedules.

items.title: Lifetime Retainer

image.alt: Retainer and retention program

items.text: Lifetime Retainer Program and flexible financing to protect your results and make care affordable.

paragraphs.text: Dr. Hess earned his Doctorate of Dental Medicine from the University of Florida (valedictorian) and a Master’s in Orthodontics from the University of Michigan. He leads the practice and provides comprehensive orthodontic care for patients of all ages.

image.alt: Dr. Michael Hess, orthodontist at Hess Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: Dr. Popat received her Doctorate from Harvard School of Dental Medicine and a Master’s in Oral & Craniofacial Sciences and Orthodontics from UCSF; she focuses on building confident smiles through personalized care.

image.alt: Dr. Paiyal Popat, orthodontist at Hess Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: Dr. Rey earned a Doctor of Dental Surgery at UCSF and a Master’s in Orthodontics from UAB. She is known for her attention to detail, ability to connect with patients, and is fluent in Spanish.

image.alt: Dr. Laura Rey, orthodontist at Hess Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: Dr. Ulrich holds a Doctorate of Dental Medicine from the University of Florida and a Master’s in Dental Sciences with a specialty certificate in Orthodontics from UTHSC. She focuses on modern orthodontic technology and patient confidence.

image.alt: Dr. Ioanna Ulrich, orthodontist at Hess Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: Dr. Cetta trained at Rutgers and holds advanced graduate training in orthodontics. He brings extensive specialty training, lifelong learning, and a patient-centered approach to care.

image.alt: Dr. Chris Cetta, orthodontist at Hess Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: From traditional braces to Invisalign<sup>®</sup> clear aligners, we offer a range of services to suit every patient.

image.alt: Patient holding Invisalign aligners
Damon braces on patient
Orthodontic retainers on a table
Child receiving interceptive orthodontic care

testimonials.author: Cheryl
testimonials.testimonial: “My experience at Hess Orthodontics has been wonderful. The staff is always friendly and Dr. Hess explains everything to his patients. Scheduling has never been a problem. I love the office décor and set up… Thanks for everything!”

testimonials.author: The Browning family
testimonials.testimonial: “Thank you so much for taking what could have been an exhausting, expensive and painful process and making it easy, affordable and (at least office visits) fun. … I will recommend your office to everyone!”

testimonials.author: Nedra
testimonials.testimonial: “Our experience here at Hess Orthodontics has been fantastic. Both my son and daughter have been lucky enough to be under the care of Dr. Hess and his staff. From the moment we walked in the door to the end of the visit, we received excellent care.”

image.alt: Parents with kids relaxing in front of home
Enjoying time together

og_meta.title: Home - Hess Orthodontics
og_meta.description: Hess Orthodontics delivers family-focused orthodontic care across Florida with Invisalign®, Damon braces, retainers, and flexible scheduling.

image.alt: Bright, modern Hess Orthodontics reception and lobby area

paragraphs.text: The orthodontic specialists and friendly team at Hess Orthodontics are highly trained and prepared to help you at every step of your orthodontic journey, from your first visit to your last. We work hard to stand above the rest and provide quality care. From the moment you walk through our doors, our team will offer a warm and welcoming office environment of care and respect.

At Hess Orthodontics, our family orthodontists share a vision for their patients that is as much about creating the healthiest and most beautiful smiles as it is about creating an environment of comfort and happiness. They are committed to exceeding patients’ expectations by consistently providing exceptional orthodontic care and positive patient experiences.

image.alt: Dr. Michael Hess headshot, Hess Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: Dr. Michael Hess earned his dental degree at the University of Florida College of Dentistry, graduating as valedictorian, and completed advanced orthodontic training at the University of Michigan, where he received a master’s degree in orthodontics. His strong academic background informs a precise, evidence-based approach to care.

image.alt: Dr. Michael Hess smiling in office

paragraphs.text: Dr. Hess combines technical excellence with a warm, patient-first approach. He enjoys the difference a confident smile can make in a person’s life and brings that passion to every case. Outside the office he spends time with his wife Julianna and son Jackson and pursues travel, music, tennis, flying, scuba diving, and skydiving.

image.alt: Dr. Michael Hess in the clinic
Dr. Paiyal Popat headshot

paragraphs.text: Dr. Paiyal Popat earned her Doctorate of Dental Medicine from Harvard School of Dental Medicine and completed her Master’s in Oral and Craniofacial Sciences and Orthodontics at the University of California, San Francisco. Her training reflects a strong foundation in both dentistry and advanced orthodontic care.

image.alt: Dr. Paiyal Popat in clinic

paragraphs.text: Dr. Popat enjoys the transformative nature of orthodontics, especially helping patients through important phases of life. When she’s not treating patients she enjoys traveling with her husband Samik and son Raiyu, dancing, exploring vegetarian restaurants, and attending soccer and basketball games.

image.alt: Dr. Paiyal Popat smiling
Dr. Laura Rey headshot

paragraphs.text: Dr. Laura Rey is a first-generation Venezuelan born to Colombian parents. She completed her dental studies in Venezuela with top honors and earned a master’s degree in orthodontics in Mexico City with honors. Dr. Rey later completed a DDS at the University of California San Francisco and a second master’s in orthodontics at the University of Alabama at Birmingham.

image.alt: Dr. Laura Rey in clinic

paragraphs.text: Dr. Rey brings meticulous attention to detail and a warm manner to every patient interaction. She is fluent in Spanish and enjoys time with her daughter Constanza, visiting ice cream shops, attending community events, reading, working out, cooking, and watching baseball.

image.alt: Dr. Laura Rey smiling
Dr. Ioanna Ulrich headshot

paragraphs.text: Dr. Ioanna “Anni” Ulrich earned a Biomedical Sciences degree with a minor in Psychology from the University of Central Florida and her DMD from the University of Florida, graduating with Cum Laude and High Research Honors. She completed specialty training in Orthodontics and Dentofacial Orthopedics at the University of Tennessee Health Science Center, where she also earned a Masters in Dental Sciences.

image.alt: Dr. Ioanna Ulrich portrait

paragraphs.text: Dr. Ulrich focuses on modern orthodontic techniques and three-dimensional imaging to help patients achieve healthy, natural smiles. She values patient support and confidence-building throughout treatment. Outside work she enjoys travel, culture, beach days, hiking, biking, and time with her cat Smokey.

image.alt: Dr. Ioanna Ulrich in clinic
Dr. Chris Cetta with family

paragraphs.text: Dr. Chris Cetta completed his dental training at Rutgers University School of Dental Medicine and advanced orthodontic studies at Jacksonville University where he earned a Certificate of Advanced Graduate Studies in Orthodontics. His broad clinical background includes years of private practice experience and ongoing contributions to industry innovation.

image.alt: Dr. Chris Cetta portrait

paragraphs.text: Dr. Cetta brings creativity and curiosity to his work, and he enjoys photography, travel, and playing bass guitar. He values family time and keeps current with advances in orthodontic technology to offer patients a range of effective treatment options.

image.alt: Dr. Chris Cetta with guitar

paragraphs.text: Hess Orthodontics is proud to partner with the Humane Society of Tampa Bay. We support local shelter efforts through donations, volunteer time, and by featuring an adoptable pet each month on our social channels.
We run in-house pet food and toy drives and participate in community volunteering. Follow us on Facebook and Instagram to see our pet of the month and upcoming community events.

image.alt: Hess Orthodontics team volunteering in a classroom
Enjoying time together

og_meta.title: About Us | Hess Orthodontics
og_meta.description: Meet the team at Hess Orthodontics. Our specialists and friendly staff provide personalized orthodontic care across multiple Tampa Bay area locations.

image.alt: Teen receiving a consultation while trying clear aligners in a modern orthodontic office

Get Started.title: What to expect at your first visit

paragraphs.text: Your complimentary consultation begins with a friendly welcome and a one-on-one review of your goals. We perform a clinical exam and take digital scans or X-rays when needed to evaluate tooth alignment and bite.
After the exam we explain your treatment options and create a personalized plan so you know next steps and estimated timing. For full details, visit: https://hessorthodontics.com/your-first-visit/

image.alt: Orthodontic consultation with patient and doctor in a bright treatment room

paragraphs.text: We offer in-house, no-interest financing that divides your treatment fee across monthly payments instead of charging interest. Our team will review options and set a plan that fits your budget.
We also work with CareCredit and most insurance providers to help you maximize orthodontic benefits. Ask our financial coordinators about available plans during your complimentary consultation.

To save time at your visit, complete new patient paperwork online or bring completed forms with you. Use our central booking page to choose a location and appointment type, or open the office-specific forms below.

image.alt: Office reception area ready to welcome new patients
Enjoying time together

seo.page_description: Schedule a complimentary orthodontic consultation with Hess Orthodontics. Find first-visit details, new patient forms, and flexible financing options.
seo.page_keywords: orthodontics, first visit, new patient, financing, Hess Orthodontics

og_meta.title: Get Started | Hess Orthodontics
og_meta.description: Schedule a complimentary orthodontic consultation with Hess Orthodontics. Find first-visit details, new patient forms, and flexible financing options.

image.alt: Smiling patients of all ages at Lakeshore Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: The Damon System uses self-ligating brackets to move teeth gently and efficiently. Available in both metal and clear bracket options, this approach is designed to increase comfort and often reduces the number of office visits.

image.alt: Two stylish smiling teens taking selfie with braces

paragraphs.text: Damon Metal Braces feature low-profile stainless steel brackets and a self-ligating system that uses shape‑memory wires to move teeth with comfort. They are durable and often deliver efficient results with fewer adjustments.
We’ll take x‑rays and photos during a complimentary consultation to recommend the best option for your needs and provide a personalized treatment estimate.

image.alt: Dental Checkup with Braces

paragraphs.text: Damon brackets have smooth rounded edges and a compact profile to reduce irritation, helping make treatment more comfortable for many patients.

image.alt: Dental Checkup with Braces

paragraphs.text: Discover whether Damon Metal is the best fit for your lifestyle at a complimentary consultation, scheduled online or by request.

image.alt: Dental Checkup with Braces
Two stylish smiling teens taking selfie with braces

paragraphs.text: Damon Clear Braces use a transparent ceramic composite and a passive slide mechanism to blend with tooth color while allowing natural movement. They aim to offer a discreet, comfortable option for patients who prefer less-visible hardware.
Damon Clear can reduce appointment frequency, is designed for comfort, and makes oral hygiene easier since it often avoids bulky elastics.

image.alt: Smiling Woman with Clear Aligner
Smiling Woman with Clear Aligner

paragraphs.text: Invisalign<sup>®</sup> uses a series of clear, removable aligners and advanced 3D imaging to create a customized plan for gentle tooth movement. It’s a discreet option that allows normal eating and easier brushing and flossing during treatment.
Treatment starts with a digital scan and complimentary consultation to determine if Invisalign<sup>®</sup> is a suitable choice for your case.

image.alt: Close-up of Invisalign aligners being placed on teeth

paragraphs.text: Angel clear aligners are a custom-made, virtually invisible tray system that gently shifts teeth when worn as directed. They’re offered as an alternative to traditional braces for many teen and adult cases.

image.alt: Modern dentist office interior with advanced technology

paragraphs.text: Our Growth Guidance program monitors bite patterns and dental development in children, starting with evaluations around age seven. The program helps identify when early treatment is needed to guide jaw growth and reduce complexity later.

image.alt: Young patient receiving early orthodontic intervention

paragraphs.text: Our Lifetime Retainer Program helps protect your results with custom removable or permanent retainers. After an initial fee, replacement retainers are provided through the program, making long‑term retention more affordable.

image.alt: Beautiful young Asian woman smiling and holding orthodontic retainer

paragraphs.text: Opalescence Boost professional whitening is offered in‑office to brighten your smile in about an hour using whitening gel and a lamp. We will discuss results and costs during your visit and can include whitening as part of a treatment plan where appropriate.

image.alt: Modern dentist office interior with advanced technology
Enjoying time together

image.alt: Hess Orthodontics practice area, bright modern treatment room with smiling patient

paragraphs.text: Find clear answers to common questions about Invisalign<sup>®</sup>, treatment timelines, cleaning and care, visits, payment options, and how to schedule with Hess Orthodontics.

accordion.header: How long does Invisalign<sup>®</sup> take to straighten teeth?

paragraphs.text: On average, Invisalign<sup>®</sup> treatment takes about 12 to 18 months, though some patients with minor concerns may finish in around six months. We create a personalized timeline at your first visit so you know what to expect; many patients notice positive changes within six weeks when aligners are worn as directed.

image.alt: Clear aligners on a model showing progressive tooth movement

accordion.header: Am I a good candidate for Invisalign<sup>®</sup>?

paragraphs.text: Invisalign<sup>®</sup> works well for many teens and adults who want a discreet option. It corrects a wide range of alignment issues, but patients with very severe bite problems may be better served with traditional braces. We’ll evaluate your case and recommend the most effective treatment.

image.alt: Orthodontic team consulting with adult patient about clear aligner treatment

paragraphs.text: Invisalign<sup>®</sup> can address many common concerns, including overbites, underbites, gaps between teeth, and mild to moderate crowding or crooked teeth. We’ll review your needs and explain whether clear aligners or another option will deliver the best results.

image.alt: Close-up of aligned teeth after orthodontic treatment

accordion.header: How do I clean Invisalign<sup>®</sup> aligners?

paragraphs.text: Rinse aligners in lukewarm water, then brush them gently with toothpaste and a soft toothbrush. Inspect for cloudy buildup and soak in a retainer or denture cleaner when needed, following the product instructions. Avoid hot water, which can warp the plastic.

image.alt: Patient cleaning clear aligners at a bathroom sink

accordion.header: How should I care for my aligners day to day?

paragraphs.text: Keep aligners in their case when not in use, remove them before eating or drinking anything but water, and brush your teeth before reinserting aligners. Bring extra sets when you travel and rinse or brush aligners after meals if brushing immediately isn’t possible.

image.alt: Clear aligner case and travel kit on a bathroom counter

accordion.header: Can I eat and drink while wearing Invisalign<sup>®</sup>?

paragraphs.text: Yes. Because the aligners are removable, you can eat and drink normally — just take them out for meals and snacks. Brush or rinse your teeth before putting aligners back in to protect your oral health and keep aligners clear.

image.alt: Patient removing clear aligners before a meal

accordion.header: Is Invisalign<sup>®</sup> more expensive than traditional braces?

paragraphs.text: In many cases, Invisalign<sup>®</sup> is comparable in cost to traditional braces. Many dental insurance plans cover aligner treatment; our team will review benefits and offer flexible payment plans to help make care affordable.

image.alt: Orthodontic team discussing payment options with patient

accordion.header: How often will I visit the office during Invisalign<sup>®</sup> treatment?

paragraphs.text: Typical follow-up visits are about every 12 weeks so we can check progress and provide new aligners. Visits are usually quick and focused; we’ll set an appointment cadence that fits your schedule.

image.alt: Orthodontic assistant preparing aligners for a patient check-up

accordion.header: Why choose Hess Orthodontics in Winter Haven for Invisalign<sup>®</sup>?

paragraphs.text: Our Winter Haven team uses advanced 3D scanning and precise digital planning to tailor Invisalign<sup>®</sup> to your smile. You’ll get personalized care, flexible scheduling, and a treatment plan designed to fit your lifestyle.

image.alt: Hess Orthodontics team smiling in a modern Winter Haven office

accordion.header: How can I schedule an appointment?

paragraphs.text: Scheduling is simple — request an appointment online at https://hessorthodontics.com/request-your-appointment/, call our office, or email us at info@hessorthodontics.com. Our team will help you find a convenient time for your consultation.

image.alt: Reception area with friendly staff ready to schedule appointments
Enjoying time together
